basic.floral_language:
Dendranthema grandiflorum 
Floriography: elegant, plain, pure
Chrysanthemum is the official flower of Beijing in China. The chrysanthemum is one of the "Four Gentlemen" in flowers in Chinese culture (the others being the plum, the orchid, and bamboo). Extremely popular. In Japan, the chrysanthemum is a symbol of the Emperor and the Imperial family.
Chrysanthemum has many cultivars in different beautiful shapes. Under sunlight, like dazzling little stars in clusters or clumps. Chrysanthemums resist cold weather, even frost, therefore loved by the public in the fall season, and are often well loved by the ancient literati. 
Chrysanthemums like sunny days, mainly blossom in September-November for 3-4 weeks.
basic.blooming: September-November flowering period, viewing period 3-4 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Likes sunshine, avoid strong direct light
maintenance.watering: Keep soil moist, water and drain timely
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply 1-2 times monthly
maintenance.pruning: After flowering remove the withered flowers, the part on the ground will wither in winter, the plant germinates again in spring
